subject: Communication
title: Cognitive Load and Stage Performance
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Cognitive Load and Stage Performance.

hook.text: Ever tried to remember your speech, watch the audience, AND manage your body language? That's overload.

buildup.text: Cognitive load theory says working memory handles only about four chunks of information at once.

discovery.text: When you memorize word-for-word, you waste cognitive resources on recall instead of connection.

twist.text: Expert speakers memorize structure, not scripts. This frees their brain for reading the room.

climax.text: By automating delivery through practice, you free mental bandwidth for presence and improvisation.

punchline.text: Don't memorize words. Memorize the map.

quiz.question: How many chunks can working memory typically handle at once?
